title: Mission Description
content: Though we won the fight against theFlame Reaver, we have lost Trianne forever.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We smell sunlight in the wind of Okhema ...

speaker: Tribbie
line: This was your favorite spot, wasn't it, Trianne?

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Trianne... Why did it have to end up like this?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Take it easy, Cas. Departure is a part of life. It's just that ours isn't as tumultuous as it is for ordinary folks.

speaker: Trinnon
line: When we started our journey, Janus had already provided their prophecy. Just like how that Titan divided themself to create the countless passages in the world...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's only natural for us to follow the same path since we inherited their destiny.

speaker: Phainon
line: If you don't mind, Tribbie...

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you still willing to unveil that past for us? The past regarding the "prophecy."

speaker: Tribbie
line: What do you seek to learn, Snowy?

speaker: Phainon
line: Mydeimos has left the city to face his own fate.

speaker: Phainon
line: That is the fate of every demigod . We will all eventually let go of our past to follow the same path as his.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, what I want to know is — As Amphoreus ' first demigod, what compelled you to take the first step on this journey?

speaker: Phainon
line: And what has sustained you to make it this far without looking back, despite the fracturing of your body and the numerous departures you have endured?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Alright.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Teacher, are you sure about this?

speaker: Tribbie
line: De is already doing what he has to do... What reason do we have to keep it from them? Let's go, everyone...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Let's go to the Abyss of Fate and see how it used to be.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Then... we will leave it to you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trinnon, would you mind?

speaker: Phainon
line: Tribbie... Are you not coming with us?

speaker: Tribbie
line: I want to stay here with Trianne for a bit longer.

speaker: Phainon
line: I see. We'll be off, then. Take care.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Since you have made your decision, then let's proceed as you wish...

speaker: Aglaea
line: See you later, teacher.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Cas, are you not going with them?

speaker: Castorice
line: No, I'd prefer to remain here to accompany Lady Trianne.

speaker: Castorice
line: She... hated being alone.

speaker: Tribbie
line: What's this...?

speaker: Castorice
line: A little gift that I had hoped to deliver to her personally... though Fate had other plans.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oh, so you saw us arguing that day?

speaker: Castorice
line: Yes. I figured Lady Trianne would like it a lot, so I bought it.

speaker: Tribbie
line: I see.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Cas, you know, I recognized it immediately that day. It truly is an authentic piece from Janusopolis .

speaker: Castorice
line: Then why...?

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's just that Trianne had forgotten far more things than I. For example...

speaker: Tribbie
line: She forgot that this glass object meant something unfortunate according to the traditions of our homeland.

speaker: Castorice
line: Ah... I'm sorry, Lady Tribbie. Should I...

speaker: Tribbie
line: No need to apologize, Cas. At that time, I simply didn't want her to be trapped by our past, especially considering how much time had passed since we left home.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But now... it might just be the perfect gift for Trianne.

speaker: Aglaea
line: "All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle —"

speaker: Aglaea
line: While you and I have long accepted this absurd fate, they remain fresh and inexperienced...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Teacher, don't let the weight of that cruel prophecy crush their spines.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But it would be even more cruel if we allow them to ignorantly fall before the gates of the new world.

speaker: Tribbie
line: They will eventually need to know the truth. We just need the right opportunity...

speaker: Tribbie
line: This, to me, feels like the right opportunity.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, this is how the Temple of the Three Fates looked back in the day...

speaker: Trinnon
line: At this point, Janusopolis still resides under Aquila 's protection, yet it is already fated for decline, and only contains a beautiful facade.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is it because Amphoreus has entered Era Bellica ?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yes. Strife remains distant from this part of Amphoreus right now, but in five years' time, at the same Entry Hour , this temple will become the source of another war.

speaker: Phainon
line: Then... where are you at this time?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Right over there...

speaker: Phainon
line: Why does she look somewhat different?

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's because...

speaker: Trinnon
line: We don't quite recall how we used to look.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...My apologies.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Please don't. We should be the ones apologizing. Come, everyone...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's time to witness our last conversation with Oronyx .

speaker: Oronyx
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Oronyx
line: Tri... bios...

speaker: Tribios
line: You're here, Oronyx .

text: Wait, I can understand the Titan language now?
Your voice now sounds so... mature.

speaker: Trinnon
line: This is our memory, so your senses are also aligned with the Tribios' of that moment.

speaker: Oronyx
line: You still... consume yourself... for that false prophecy.

speaker: Tribios
line: "False prophecy," huh? So you still think that way.

speaker: Oronyx
line: Even if Kephale has fallen... they would never guide humans to kill their own comrades.

speaker: Oronyx
line: Stop while you still can. Tribios... Spreading the prophecy will only kindle disaster. That disaster... will tear you into a thousand pieces.

speaker: Tribios
line: But the black tide has already arrived, and Janus remains in slumber. If even the god of passages, known for guiding mortals, cannot resist this catastrophe, then what can we do against the incoming destruction?

speaker: Oronyx
line: Do not... get involved with the Coreflames . If you do that... You can still remain chosen by fate.

speaker: Tribios
line: Those chosen by fate would never have their family taken from them.

speaker: Tribios
line: And how can I alone remain safe and secure, while watching the entire world crumble before my eyes?

speaker: Tribios
line: This might be our last conversation, Oronyx . I will do everything I can... to protect you from the black tide.

speaker: Phainon
line: The "family" she just mentioned...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's our mother . She fell from this spot into the valley a long time ago...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It was during a grand ceremony held to seek Janus ' guidance...

speaker: Trinnon
line: But things took an unexpected turn... It was Kephale who responded instead.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Did something go wrong with the ceremony?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yes, but those two occurrences were in fact unrelated. Kephale 's response was simply a coincidence.

speaker: Trinnon
line: On that frosty night with treachery abound, as the Holy Maiden of Janusopolis met her demise... the Worldbearing Titan also fell in another corner of the world.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Let's keep up with her. This story... she should be the one to tell it.

text: Advance towards the Archive of Prophecies at the left of the altar

title: Step Description
content: Through (Trailblazer)'s power, Phainon's group journeys to the past of the Abyss of Fate — the "Sanctum of Prophecy" Janusopolis, where they see the Tribbie trio as they were a thousand years ago.

speaker: Phainon
line: That thing ahead...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's the altar of Talanton .

speaker: Trinnon
line: But that's not our destination. We're heading to the left.

speaker: Phainon
line: This place used to be passable, huh...

speaker: Phainon
line: I never thought there would be such a hidden space in the Abyss.

speaker: Trinnon
line: This is the Archive of Prophecies, an important ceremonial site back then.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is this... Janus' Maze that Trinnon used for divination in the past?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Not only that. It also serves as a lock — our childhood abode lies sealed within.

speaker: Phainon
line: This is the largest puzzle I've ever laid eyes on, and it even acts as a door lock... Should've expected something like this in the homeland of puzzles, I suppose. So, how are we going to solve it?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Just follow the designated path and let the stone ball fall into the pool twice.

speaker: Phainon
line: Seems pretty straightforward. Even Mydei might be able to complete it in a single try.

text: How could you talk smack about Mydei behind his back!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That's not talking smack. It's clearly a compliment.

text: I agree it's straightforward, but Mydei might need at least two shots at it.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You still don't know him well enough then. He might not even need a first try — he'd just punch the door open.

speaker: Phainon
line: Mydei... If he were still here, we'd probably take a lot fewer detours to solve our issues.

speaker: Phainon
line: Enough with the talking. Let's just get started!

text: Press the button and hold to activate the rewinding power and rotate the maze. During the rewind, let go of the button and the maze will spin in reverse direction. Combine gravity with the maze's spin to guide the stone orb out of the maze! Press the button and hold to activate the rewinding power and rotate the maze. During the rewind, let go of the button and the maze will spin in reverse direction. Combine gravity with the maze's spin to guide the stone orb out of the maze!
One of the encryption keys has been locked, and the confusion rumbles, becoming a new path. Let the stone ball fall into the pool once more, to open the hidden door.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Impressive. You too have the makings of a High Priest now.

text: Complete the second Janus' Maze and open the gates

speaker: Phainon
line: Tsk, getting that stone ball to the endpoint looks pretty tough... My hands are shaking just from looking at it.

text: Some special wall panels will move in a set pattern . Use the right timing to take advantage of their traits to move the stone orb. Some special wall panels will move in a set pattern . Use the right timing to take advantage of their traits to move the stone orb.

title: Step Description
content: As Trinnon returned to her homeland, familiar sights stirred forgotten memories within her — of people, moments, and treasures she thought time had washed away.

speaker: Phainon
line: The secret door is open.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Go inside... and you'll see the place where we grew up.

speaker: Phainon
line: You grew up... in a place like this?

speaker: Trinnon
line: By the time we were born, the role of the Holy Maiden had already diminished to a mere title. Those in tune with the Titan's guidance are bound to become messengers for others.

speaker: Trinnon
line: To maintain appearances, those in authority added some embellishments. And with Mother around, our childhood wasn't entirely without joy.

speaker: Phainon
line: Even so, I still find it hard to imagine.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Twenty years can go by in no time.

speaker: Phainon
line: Trinnon, for most people... twenty years is a long period of time.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Right. Becoming a demigod sure changes how one lives through time...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ▶ It's hard to believe that it's been so long. Your power is exceptional, (Trailblazer). This place looks exactly as before...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Let's explore the room a bit.

speaker: Phainon
line: The shelf is packed full, but all I see are annals of geography for various cities. There are also documents about various kinds of Titan worship...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Because we believed that we would need to travel great distances to convey Kephale 's prophecy to everyone, and should learn about the terrains and customs of various places beforehand.

text: Don't tell me you actually read them all...
Reading all of this... that's crazy.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Back then, our memories were still sharp. Ten years was enough for us to memorize all these.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Mother left us these scrolls too. When we were young, she would read them to us as bedtime stories. Her stories were so engaging that we could vividly imagine all of Amphoreus in our dreams.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Unfortunately, only after Mother was gone did we realize that what was written in the scrolls was far from engaging.

speaker: Phainon
line: There is a blackboard here. What's that drawing on it?

speaker: Trinnon
line: That doesn't ring a bell. It should be something we invented during those ten years.

speaker: Trinnon
line: It has been approximately ten years between Kephale 's prophecy and this moment, when we are about to set out.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We were raised in this temple complex and had never stepped outside the Gate of Infinity. To understand the outside world, we spent much of our time acquiring knowledge and developing a few inventions along the way.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Sadly, the inventions served no purpose except to deliver letters, and the knowledge we gained... has all faded away by now.

speaker: Phainon
line: There are so many boxes here…

speaker: Trinnon
line: These should be our belongings... Huh? What's this?

speaker: Phainon
line: A red glass fragment?

text: I've seen this type of glass before.
It looks like a specialty from your hometown.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We were still very young the first time we saw it. Mother came back with a beautiful glass piece, but her face was streaked with tears. She simply placed it on the table.

speaker: Trinnon
line: It looked so sparkly that we couldn't resist playing with it, but we ended up breaking it by accident. Mother didn't get angry. She simply held us quietly for a long time.

speaker: Trinnon
line: It wasn't until we were older that we learned in Janusopolis, if someone gloriously died for destiny, the Holy Maiden must pick a piece of glass from the volcano's quarry and polish it, then give it to the deceased's family.

speaker: Trinnon
line: On the day Mother returned with the glass, her friend lost his life on the battlefield. Since he had no family left, Mother had to keep it herself...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Later, on the eve of the ritual... Mother also gave us a beautiful piece of glass.

text: Walk with Trinnon to Tribios' bedroom

speaker: Trinnon
line: Let's move on to the bedroom.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's Tribios...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Just as expected. It's time to get going, after all.

speaker: Tribios
line: Mama... are you going to that ritual tomorrow?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: That's right, my sweet girl. What's the matter?

speaker: Tribios
line: I wish I could go too... I have something to ask Janus .

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Oh? What do you want to ask?

speaker: Tribios
line: I want to know how to chase the black tide away!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Ah, I see. Unfortunately, it's a secret ritual, and only I can preside over it.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: If you want me to consult the Titan on your behalf... you'll have to promise me something.

speaker: Tribios
line: What is it?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Be a good girl and go to sleep now, and whatever you dream of, don't be afraid—

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Just sleep through the night, until morning comes, until the next time Aquila opens [ sic ] their eyes. Can you do that for me, sweetie?

speaker: Tribios
line: That's it? Of course I can! Tribios is the most amazing Holy Maiden of Janus ... Well, little Holy Maiden!

speaker: Tribios
line: But... why, Mama?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Because... this ritual might take a long time.

speaker: Tribios
line: How long?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Tomorrow, my sweet child. I'll be back tomorrow.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: If not tomorrow, then the next tomorrow. If not the tomorrow after that. But if I still haven't returned for a very long time...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: That means the ritual has succeeded. It means I've found a way to chase away the black tide and reached the new world on the other side. But for various reasons, I can't return to bring my sweet girl with me.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: But I'll be waiting for you there. As long as you stay brave and kind, we'll meet again in that new world.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: It's the end of the west wind, the black tide's other shore, a radiant sea of flowers blessed and protected by the gods.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: In the rosy horizon, you'll see a silver-white shoal. It marks the end of your voyage — a haven free from storms, cold, and heavy rains. No sorrow can linger there... That is where I'll be waiting for you.

speaker: Tribios
line: Wow! That sounds just like the island from my dream!

speaker: Tribios
line: Oh, I know! I'll turn the moon into a ship and the stars into sails to go find Mama! Pinky promise?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Mmm, pinky promise.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: As long as you sail toward tomorrow, as long as the sun will rise for the next day...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Our wishes will come true together.

speaker: Tribios
line: If the final murmurs of the Titan are true...

speaker: Tribios
line: If such a place really exists on the shore beyond the black tide and at the end of "Genesis"...

speaker: Tribios
line: Then our promise still stands.

speaker: Tribios
line: ...Please wait for me, Mother.

speaker: Trinnon
line: After those ten years of darkness, when Aquila opened their eyes for the last time...

speaker: Trinnon
line: We finally set off.

speaker: Phainon
line: Where... did she go?

speaker: Trinnon
line: This way. Now, we'll go through this shelf.

speaker: Phainon
line: But how? With Janus ' power?

text: Can the power of passages even go through walls?

children.speaker: Trinnon
children.line: No, we hadn't acquired their power back then.

text: She hadn't become a demigod yet.

children.speaker: Trinnon
children.line: Indeed. We hadn't acquired their power back then.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, this obstacle... it was simply a mirage?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yes, the answer is right on the shelf. Go ahead and give it a try.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's a secret passage...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It was a secret passage prepared by the Holy Maiden's supporters for Mother and me as a precaution...

speaker: Trinnon
line: And now, it has turned into our passage to escape, just as anticipated.

text: (Open the door next to theHidden Passage of ContemplationSpace Anchor)

speaker: Phainon
line: The path to the temple was in quite a state... Did someone do it on purpose?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Mmm, no surprise at all. Some people caught on to what we were planning and tried to intercept us ...

speaker: Trinnon
line: While others were willing to clear the way for the Holy Maiden.

text: Try to open up the way for Tribios

speaker: Tribios
line: I can't move it... Can't climb over it either...

speaker: Tribios
line: I can't move it... Can't climb over it either...

speaker: Tribios
line: Time Titan... is that you?

text: (Idle chat, Tribios at a broken pathway)

speaker: Tribios
line: Someone will help me...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Just like this.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Regardless of our actions, the past will remain unchanged. It was someone else who helped Tribios in the actual events of history.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We don't remember the details. As for why Memory recreated the past to be like this, it must be because...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's closer to the answer within our heart.

speaker: Tribios
line: The passage... is now cleared!

text: (Idle chat, Tribios at a broken pathway)

speaker: Tribios
line: Oronyx , it's you again...

speaker: Tribios
line: Thank you, nameless god!

speaker: Phainon
line: Whoa, it looked truly magnificent back then!

speaker: Tribios
line: Relax... Take it easy...

speaker: Phainon
line: All these people... They're just civilians, not enemies, correct?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Mostly, but it might not be the case later on.

text: (Attempt to leave the main road, optional)

speaker: Holy City Guard
line: Please stay clear.

speaker: Tribios
line: Hey, little ones! How did you sneak in here?

speaker: Small Boy
line: Shh, shh! Please keep it down! We had to be really sneaky to get in here!

speaker: Tribios
line: Okay, okay. But what did you sneak in here for?

speaker: Little Girl
line: I heard there's a lovely Holy Maiden living in the temple, and I wanna meet her!

speaker: Small Boy
line: I couldn't stop her, so I had to think of a way to sneak her in.

speaker: Tribios
line: Oh, really? I was here to meet the Holy Maiden as well! But the guard said she had to go somewhere far away today.

speaker: Little Girl
line: Huh? What a bummer! Mommy even asked me to bring her gift to the Holy Maiden...

speaker: Tribios
line: It's getting late! Be good and go home now, okay?

speaker: Little Girl
line: Okay, then. We'll come back next time! Thank you!

speaker: Trinnon
line: By the way they are dressed, the siblings look like civilians living outside the temple. Mother mentioned that when she was a Holy Maiden, she caught a girl sneaking into the temple to steal the tributes.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Stealing from the temple was punishable by death, but that poor girl had no family and just wanted something to eat. So, Mother took her outside and even gave her some food.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Perhaps these two children are the descendants of that girl from back then.

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: Ah, Lady Maiden!

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: Lady Maiden, you need to dress warmer! It's pretty cold out. Let me get you a blanket...

speaker: Tribios
line: No need to trouble yourself. I'm just going for a quick walk.

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: ...Alright, but please take care of yourself. Your mother made us promise to look after you before she left.

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: Hehe, it's been a while since I last saw you, and I just realized you've grown into such a beauty, just like your mother.

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: Here, have some of my sweet pastries. She used to enjoy them, so maybe you'll like them too.

speaker: Amiable Woman
line: What's wrong, Lady Maiden?

speaker: Tribios
line: I'm... fine. It tastes... really good.

speaker: Trinnon
line: This lady is Mother's old friend. When we were little, we sometimes got to eat the sweet pastries she brought back.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We've always remembered the familiar taste, and only now do we learn where it came from.

text: Follow Tribios and cross the bridge

speaker: Trinnon
line: This lady is Mother's old friend. When we were little, we sometimes got to eat the sweet pastries she brought back.

speaker: Dagra
line: Hey, Lady Maiden! It's been a while! What's got you out and about today? Did your little inventions fly off on their own again?

speaker: Dagra
line: Come on, don't give me that look! I promise, it wasn't me this time!

speaker: Dagra
line: While I didn't take them this time, I can't speak for others. Your craftsmanship is brilliant! Those toys of yours could fetch a great price out there, hehe.

speaker: Trinnon
line: This man... he's a good-for-nothing son of a merchant family, loitering around the temple and cashing in on the pilgrims' lost tributes. He even swipes our inventions now and then.

speaker: Trinnon
line: People like this are best forgotten...

speaker: Holy City Guard
line: Apologies, Lady Maiden, but the Janus Vault is under maintenance today.

speaker: Tribios
line: Perfect. That way, no one will disturb me while I'm talking to Mother.

speaker: Holy City Guard
line: *sigh* Alright then. May Janus guide your path.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Janus Vault?

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's where Janus ' heart lies and the Coreflame is kept. Just enter on the left...

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's also the place where Tribios was born.

text: Follow Tribios and head to the Janus Vault
Try to open the way forward

speaker: Phainon
line: Tribios... what does that name actually mean?

speaker: Trinnon
line: "The one with three lives." Mother believed our birth was blessed by the Three Titans of Fate. She named us thus to express her gratitude.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Looking at how things have unfolded, fate might have had a role in it.

text: (Use Oronyx's Miracle at the end of the puzzle)

speaker: Tribios
line: Finally... the Janus Vault is right ahead.

text: Keep following Tribios to the Janus Vault

speaker: Tribios
line: At long last...

speaker: Janus
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Janus
line: Tribios... you've come.

speaker: Tribios
line: ...I knew there was some sanity left in you, Janus . Just as I thought... you too have been confined.

speaker: Janus
line: Step forth, and thou shalt bury yourself...

speaker: Janus
line: Bury the gods, and bury the fate that binds us all.

speaker: Tribios
line: No, Janus ...

speaker: Tribios
line: I've come here... to take on your fate.

speaker: Tribios
line: By the blood of the lamb and the strength of my blade-wielding right hand...

speaker: Tribios
line: I am Tribios, the Listener, the announcer, and the witness of the prophecy —

speaker: Tribios
line: — I, the Holy Maiden of Janusopolis, the walker of the infinite paths, have come forth to assume your duty .

speaker: Janus
line: Hehe...

speaker: Janus
line: The one who guides the world shall see their soul shattered into a thousand fragments, akin to glass crashing upon the ground...

speaker: Tribios
line: Just as I wished. This journey promises to be a long one. With a thousand selves to accompany me, I'll never be lonely.

speaker: Janus
line: Though thou bearest the Coreflame, thou shalt be far from the glory of divinity. "Passages" are forever associated with dirt, and even a mere mortal's blade can imperil thy very existence...

speaker: Tribios
line: No matter. My hands are not made for bearing arms, but my feet are destined to embark on a journey for the benefit of all.

speaker: Janus
line: Yet, the Flame-Chase is a journey of constant loss, among which even life itself holds little value....

speaker: Janus
line: Time decays the heart, the passages shatter the body, and the scales weigh the separation, until the end draws near...

speaker: Janus
line: The one who bears three lives... art thou truly prepared?

speaker: Tribios
line: Without a doubt, Titan. Let the prophecy shatter me —

speaker: Tribios
line: — so that I may open a myriad of paths for this imperiled world!

speaker: Janus
line: Thus... it shall be...

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Overthrow the gods — / Return the Coreflames —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Inherit divine authority — / Forge godly miracles —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Go kill — / Go mourn —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Kill my kin — / Mourn our fate —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Ferry the spirits of the gods — / Nourish the land with divine essence —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Yet, thou shalt remember — / Yet, thou must remember —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle —

speaker: Dying Titan
line: Such... is destiny —

speaker: Tribios
line: I understand, Janus ...

speaker: Tribios
line: Thank you. Now... may you rest well.

speaker: Tribios
line: Mother...

speaker: Tribios
line: Did you... see that?

speaker: Tribios
line: I have assumed my duty and stand ready to set out...

speaker: Tribios
line: We will step over the gods' corpses and wander among humanity...

speaker: Tribios
line: And thus, we shall sweep apart Amphoreus' pitch-dark fog...

speaker: Tribios
line: May we... May the world...

speaker: Tribios
line: Follow the myriad paths trodden and reunite at the end of the west wind... where flowers bloom in spring.

speaker: Tribios
line: Mother... I shall see you tomorrow.

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: Who dares lay hands on the Coreflame! Drop your weapon and surrender at once!

speaker: Tribios
line: I knew this would come.

text: Face the holy city's guards together with Tribios

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: It's opening up! Move aside and get ready —

speaker: Scared Holy City Guard
line: The Holy Maiden...?

speaker: Scared Holy City Guard
line: What's happening here? Lady Maiden, where's the thief who stole the Coreflame?

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: Look at what she's holding, you buffoon! She is the thief —

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: Take your positions and ready your arms! We're taking back the Coreflame!

speaker: Tribios
line: ...Bring it on.

speaker: Scared Holy City Guard
line: ...What?

speaker: Tribios
line: Come forth, loyal guards. At least do it properly — pierce me in the chest.

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: What are you scheming?

speaker: Tribios
line: This is your last chance. If anyone wants to earn a promotion and rise through the ranks —

speaker: Tribios
line: I'm right here. You all know who I am — go ahead.

speaker: Tribios
line: However, if there's still any loyalty within you, step aside for the Holy Maiden...

speaker: Tribios
line: Otherwise, by the decree of the holy city's codex, anyone who dares to harm the Holy Maiden shall face execution!

speaker: Scared Holy City Guard
line: C—Captain, what should we do...

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: Do it... Kill her!

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: If any of you want to get rich, then come with me! Take this traitor's head and wealth will be ours!

speaker: Phainon
line: We can't just stand by and do nothing — let's move, partner!

speaker: Strict Holy City Guard
line: How's... that possible...?

speaker: Scared Holy City Guard
line: Could the Titan... actually be on her side...?

speaker: Holy City Guards
line: The traitor's over there! / Get her! / That red-head woman is the traitor!

speaker: Tribios
line: ...I should go.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Let's keep up.

text: Open the way together with Tribios

title: Step Description
content: Tribios takes the Coreflame of Passage, receiving Janus's divine authority. Now, she must flee this Sanctum of Tripartite Prophecy that has held her captive for decades and pursue her destiny.

speaker: Tribios
line: The path... is opening up for me.

speaker: Tribios
line: O Janus ... protect me.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go! Clear the path for her!

speaker: Tribios
line: Run! Go faster!

speaker: Tribios
line: The main path is likely well-guarded... What do I do?

speaker: Tribios
line: Just as I thought... Inside!

speaker: Tribios
line: There are guards here, too. Don't alert them.

speaker: Tribios
line: At long last...

speaker: Tribios
line: A creature of the holy city guards? But I'm already so close...

speaker: Phainon
line: This should be the last fight. We have to help her get through.

speaker: Phainon
line: But... I don't get it. This has been puzzling me for a while now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Who has been aiding Tribios in her escape?

text: I've been curious about that, too...
Logic in Amphoreus isn't adding up.

speaker: Phainon
line: While history might be blurred by memories, seeing how the whole city is hunting her down, she clearly had no allies...

speaker: Phainon
line: If she pulled it off alone, were we too involved in this process?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Tribios had been on her own since she entered the vault.

speaker: Trinnon
line: But what did we truly mean to her? You'll find that answer at the end of this memory.

speaker: Phainon
line: In that case, let's focus on the mission at hand now. Let's do this, everyone!

speaker: Tribios
line: Finally... beyond this gate awaits a boundless world.

speaker: Tribios
line: This is where my journey begins.

speaker: Tribios
line: God of passages, can you see me? I will complete the path... that you started.

speaker: Tribios
line: No response after all. Janus ... may you have a good dream.

speaker: Tribios
line: I can't stay here much longer. It's time to leave.

speaker: Phainon
line: Well... looks like this is the end of the memory.

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...Not yet.

speaker: Trinnon
line: The question that has been puzzling you...

text: File:Trailblaze Mission Passage, Reveal the Past Once More 2 Caelus.png

speaker: Trinnon
line: She's about to reveal the answer.

speaker: Phainon
line: But nothing happened.

speaker: Phainon
line: What was making her, or you, hesitate at this moment?

speaker: Phainon
line: If she had known this Flame-Chase Journey would proceed as the Titan foretold, bringing about great suffering and fatalities, including her own...

speaker: Phainon
line: Would she still have chosen to walk through the gate and start her journey?

speaker: Tribios
line: I think...

text: File:Trailblaze Mission Passage, Reveal the Past Once More 3 Caelus.png

speaker: Tribios
line: The answer is already within you, and you've made your own decision.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What?

speaker: Phainon
line: You can... hear us?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Not really...

speaker: Trinnon
line: She can neither see nor hear us.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yet, she knew that one day, someone would return to unveil this dust-covered memory.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We can never know for sure who helped us back then. But that kindness was forever engraved in our hearts, motivating us to move forward. Time has modified this memory into a special letter, so that we do not forget our original intent.

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's a letter written by Tribios of the past and sent to her future self. In this memory, it is Tribios of the future who overcomes all difficulties for her and sends her on a long journey... toward the tomorrow where we are.

speaker: Tribios
line: Yes, you'll remember it all, and then find your way back to the gate where everything began.

text: File:Trailblaze Mission Passage, Reveal the Past Once More 2 Caelus.png

speaker: Tribios
line: Here, I will set sail toward the distant horizon.

speaker: Tribios
line: Here, you have traveled far on your way home.

speaker: Tribios
line: Such is the maxim that unveils Tribios' fate: "You shall shatter into a thousand fragments and wither on the soil of foreign lands."

speaker: Tribios
line: So, if you ever feel lost, return to this place. I'll keep this memory here for you — or for me — to embrace it again.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Worry not. Though loss is something we've grown used to, our resolve and our pledge are what Tribios will never forget.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Each one of us has never failed to remember.

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Losses are a constant on the Flame-Chase journey, among which even life itself holds little value."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "The hot blood of the sacrificial lamb will not be spilled in vain, like my mother and I."

speaker: Tribios
line: "The libations poured are guaranteed to bear fruit, just as my blade-wielding right hand is not a hollow formality."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Surmount the myriad passages of Janus , and we will once again—"

speaker: Tribios
line: "Ride the west wind and let the wings carry us far away."

speaker: Phainon
line: So this... is your answer.

speaker: Tribios
line: That's right. In the name of the Three Fates, I stand by my answer with no regrets.

speaker: Tribios
line: Now, with or without the gods' blessing...

speaker: Tribios
line: I run towards the world's agony.

speaker: Tribios
line: If I can truly pierce through the utter darkness...

speaker: Tribios
line: We will meet again at the end of the west wind where flowers bloom in spring.

text: "Janusopolis' Holy Maiden" Tribios bore the Coreflame to quell the world's chaos and became a demigod of Janus.
She traversed the "Gate of Infinity," splitting into a thousand messengers to spread the divine prophecy across the land of Amphoreus.
After a century of arduous journeying...

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Tribbie, do you still think...

speaker: Castorice
line: That everything will be fine tomorrow?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yeah, that's what Trianne would say as well.

speaker: Castorice
line: With all due respect...

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Tribbie, you know perfectly well... that see you tomorrow is nothing but a white lie.

speaker: Castorice
line: I hope your toughness is not a mask hiding a lonely heart.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Cas, that's not a lie.

speaker: Tribbie
line: See you tomorrow is the greatest prophecy in the world.

speaker: Castorice
line: Prophecy...?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Listen. In every corner of this land, every heartbeat carries a prayer for that prophecy to come true.

speaker: Tribbie
line: It may be that only a few heroes will bring tomorrow to the new world, but the prophecy of leading everyone to tomorrow belongs to all in Amphoreus.

speaker: Castorice
line: But not everyone has the chance to see tomorrow. How can such words be called a prophecy?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Because people believe it will come true, and they are trying hard to hold onto that belief.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Even as the world teeters on the brink of collapse, everyone is pressing forward, longing to reach farther and move toward tomorrow.

speaker: Tribbie
line: And that is why a Holy Maiden exists to lead the world toward tomorrow, and why Janusopolis' prophecy unfolds as passages.

speaker: Tribbie
line: "Fate" is not about the outcome, but the journey. It's not the flowers that bloom at the end of the road...

speaker: Tribbie
line: But rather the paths that lead beyond the gate, where people tread toward the sea of flowers.

speaker: Tribbie
line: So, Cas, if anything is troubling you, just set it aside for tomorrow.

speaker: Tribbie
line: There's no difference between demigods and mortals. The troubles we encounter can only be resolved by our future selves.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Reflect through the long night, wait for the dawn as you think, then set off at daybreak. The hesitant part of us will be left behind in the dark, while the determined side of us will know no fear.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Because that's how Tribios has journeyed so far to spread the prophecy...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Beckoning the morning sun... and the tomorrow it promises to bring.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: We will now continue the journey and face our destiny.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: We will step over the gods' corpses and wander among humanity. And thus, we shall sweep apart Amphoreus' pitch-dark fog.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: And at the end, all will reach that silver-white shoal, that end of the journey, that new world and new tomorrow.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: It is a haven free from storms, cold, and heavy rains. No sorrow can linger there.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: We've made a promise to meet again at the end of the west wind, where flowers bloom in spring.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hehe...

speaker: Cerces
line: Child of humanity, surely you are not waiting for the arrival of night?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Nights do not fall upon Okhema.

speaker: Cerces
line: That's why it's futile for you to wait here.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...Honestly, I didn't expect the renowned Reason Titan to behave like this.

speaker: Cerces
line: Heh... And that's all thanks to you. If your soul weren't as prickly as a hedgehog, I wouldn't have to act this way.

speaker: Cerces
line: If you were more accommodating, you wouldn't be opposing me all the time, and I could teach you more freely instead.

speaker: Anaxa
line: It was you who insisted on implanting the Coreflame in me... Forget it. Cut the sarcasm and just say what you need to say.

speaker: Cerces
line: Fine, fine. All I want is to remind you...

speaker: Cerces
line: There's not much left in your soul. If you don't do something soon, I will have to take over this body.

speaker: Anaxa
line: If I'm not worried, why should you be? I know what you're planning. You just want my help answering the question —

speaker: Anaxa
line: "What exactly are 'we'?" Correct?

speaker: Cerces
line: It's good that you remember. Thus, "equivalent exchange" — it's only fair.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Then, rest easy. The answer will soon be revealed, and you'll have to return my body shortly.

speaker: Cerces
line: Hehe, is that true?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Certainly. I initially thought this extremely frail state would hinder me from getting my body back...

speaker: Anaxa
line: But I didn't expect the answer to be right within it. Hmph, that saved me a lot of trouble — I don't even need the black-robed swordmaster 's ceremonial blade.

speaker: Cerces
line: That's certainly worth celebrating.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Regrettably... I can't carry out the upcoming experiment alone.

speaker: Cerces
line: The girl who's walking with death... is she fully prepared?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Be patient, Titan...

speaker: Anaxa
line: If we're always so guarded, how can "Death" reach us easily?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Unfortunately, on behalf of Okhema, I must ask you to slow your pace.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh... I forgot about you. My apologies.

speaker: Aglaea
line: A child's words are always carefree. I'll just dismiss these words as nonsense from a cheeky child.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Come now, conceited "performer." It's time to address your relationship with that Titan .

speaker: Anaxa
line: What if I refuse?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Provocation will only tip Talanton 's scales further toward your demise. There's no need to go to such lengths.

speaker: Anaxa
line: O monster neither human nor divine, don't forget that you won't dare kill me. If you snuff out the Coreflame of "Reason" —

speaker: Anaxa
line: What else can you use to stand against the Council ?

speaker: Cerces
line: Eh... Do you two mind if I cut in?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I warned you. Do not interrupt me —

speaker: Cerces
line: Ahh. I just have been meaning to ask: Does death really matter to you?

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...What do you mean?

speaker: Cerces
line: What I mean is, before I implanted the Coreflame into your heart...

speaker: Cerces
line: ...you were already a silent, cold corpse.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ I'm back. Finally have a moment to catch my breath. Want to chat, (Trailblazer)?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's unusual to see Mem isn't with you.

text: Let Mem rest. They've had a tiring past few days.
No idea. I can't control Mem...
Don't worry. They're inside the ball.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Let's not joke about monsters in your pockets.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Since they're not here, let me ask you — are you really sure you want to take on the trial of Oronyx 's Coreflame on behalf of the Chrysos Heirs?

text: Absolutely! I don't see why not.
Still on the fence. It was Mem's idea...
It's about time for me to level up.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...We've ended up at this point after all. This is probably a fate that "Trailblaze" can't evade.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You should be extra cautious and watch out for yourself. Based on the experiences of those before you, the trial is no walk in the park.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But what concerns me even more is that you'll further bind yourself to Amphoreus... If you truly assume that Titan's divinity, do you believe you'll be able to lay it down again?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Forget it. We'll deal with that when the time comes. No matter what happens, I'll be right there with you.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Oh, by the way, I got held up by two people in guard uniforms and ended up missing Trianne's farewell ceremony.

text: Aww, how sweet! But where were you earlier?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I got held up by two people in guard uniforms and ended up missing Trianne's farewell ceremony.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: They said they were messengers of the Council of Elders and wanted to verify my identity.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But I suspect we've been on their radar for a while... and they only made their move when you and I got separated.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Their questions were quite specific, from how we arrived in Okhema to our relationships with each Chrysos Heir. They even asked about what we did in the market.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Luckily, those pawns aren't the brightest. I managed to brush off most of their questions, so they'll probably leave us alone for a bit.

text: The Council of Elders... are they the bad guys?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'm not ready to label them as good or bad, but their conduct... is certainly irritating.

text: Looks like dark undercurrents are roiling in Okhema.
Is this foreshadowing for the next version?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But on second thought, Aglaea also initially kept her guard up with us. It's best not to provoke either side until we know the full truth.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The only thing we know for sure is that some members of the Council of Elders aren't happy with the Chrysos Heirs . In the worst-case scenario... we could be caught up in the internal conflicts of the holy city.

text: That's the episode I hate the most.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If only we had more time to sort through the clues about the black tide. But now...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The weather is the only lovely thing left. Let's take some more pictures.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Huh? What's going on?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Something wrong, Dan Heng?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ah...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The memory card is full.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I bet March and the others are pretty worried too.

speaker: Tribbie
line: And so, this long day passed for Okhema.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Some people arrived, and some left forever, just like every other day of this journey where we, stumbling, move forward.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We have long been prepared. If we are to chase the flames, then we must grow used to farewells. And yet...

speaker: Tribbie
line: No one back then could foresee...

speaker: Tribbie
line: "Death"... Its arrival would always be so sudden and so momentous.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ▶ Even (Trailblazer), coming from beyond the sky, could not escape the Reaper's two hands. And what people gained and lost in that trial of "Death"...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Was far heavier than "Life" itself.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Just like the destiny that the prophecy revealed for Cas...

speaker: Tribbie
line: "At the end of the sea of flowers, the souls of the living shall warm thy fingertips..."

speaker: Tribbie
line: "And after an embrace... there shall be eternal separation."

children.text:
(UnlockAchievementThe World Is Thus: One Generation Rises, Another Wilts)
(ObtainTrianne Doll×1,Strumming Time×1)
(Obtain a strand of Nameless Recollection forAs I've Written)

The god-king had returned home and the messenger had departed. Their fates can no longer be scried, but are worthy of remembering. The testaments of character witnessed during your travels. Head to the book and write it down.
